intro: Styrax japonicus var. calycothrix, commonly known as the Japanese snowbell, is a deciduous shrub native to Japan. It is characterized by its clusters of small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are glossy and dark green, providing an attractive appearance throughout the growing season. It prefers well-drained soil and partial to full sun, making it suitable for gardens and landscapes. Its ornamental value comes from its fragrant flowers and attractive foliage, which make it a popular choice for ornamental horticulture.
